data.event: Nako Monastery, dated to 1025, is located in the village as well as several other Buddhist chortens.

event.title: now on a more stable location near the Nako Lake (formed

data.event: The village is now on a more stable location near the Nako Lake (formed by the slopes of the mountains of Reo Purgyal), compared to the opposite bank across the Nako river where it was located earlier and then shifted because of tectonic upliftment of the site.
